definition: overcast (weather)/cloudy/shady/Yin (the negative principle of Yin and Yang)/negative (electric.)/feminine/moon/implicit/hidden/genitalia
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: One cannot overlook his uncanny ability to navigate the many political intrigues and maneuverings.
sentences.chinese: 沒人能忽略他平息各種政治陰謀詭計的稟賦。

sentences.english: Such machinations will likely only get worse.
sentences.chinese: 而使用陰謀詭計只能讓事情變得更糟。

sentences.english: You're a scheming little devil, aren't you?
sentences.chinese: 你是個耍陰謀詭計的小魔鬼，對不對？

sentences.english: The palace was a nest of intrigue.
sentences.chinese: 這座宮殿曾是陰謀詭計的策源地。

sentences.english: In my experience, in most cases there is no hidden agenda.
sentences.chinese: 依我的經驗，多數情況下並不存在什麼陰謀詭計。

sentences.english: Thus intrigues and conspiracies do not arise, and thievery and robbery do not occur;
sentences.chinese: 所以一切私心小智和陰謀詭計永不發生。

sentences.english: They talked about so-called democracy all the time, but privately make fucking intrigue.
sentences.chinese: 他們表面講什麼民主政治，背地裏搞他媽的陰謀詭計。

sentences.english: He exposed all the tricks of the enemy .
sentences.chinese: 他揭露了敵人的一切陰謀詭計。

sentences.english: I also believe that being persuasive has nothing to do with using sneaky or underhanded tactics.
sentences.chinese: 我也相信要想有說服力與耍陰謀詭計無關。

sentences.english: I prefer intrigue, don't want too close to me.
sentences.chinese: 我比較喜歡陰謀詭計，希望不要太接近我。

sentences.english: Those who go in for intrigues and conspiracy are doomed to failure.
sentences.chinese: 搞陰謀詭計的人註定要失敗。

sentences.english: He told about the intrigues of the Tsar's government.
sentences.chinese: 他講述了俄國沙皇政府的種種陰謀詭計。

sentences.english: You never know he may be foxing.
sentences.chinese: 你絕不會知道，他也許在搞陰謀詭計。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to walk right into the trap
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
